name: Media & Policy Landscape
title: Can anxiety in lonely night owls trigger social media addiction? | FOX 28 Spokane
description: By Stephen Beech Loneliness and anxiety among "night owls" trigger smartphone and social media addiction, according to new research. Young adults who stay up all hours are more prone to developing "problematic" relationships with technology due to a "vicious cycle" as a result of being more active in the evening, say scientists. title: ‘Night Owls’ More Vulnerable To Social Media Addiction Due To Being ‘Socially Out Of Sync’ And Lonely
description: Young adults who prefer staying up late at night are far more likely to develop problematic smartphone and social media habits, and a new study suggests it isnt just about screen time, its about loneliness and anxiety.
